abstracts.cdata!:
The Children and Youth Development
            Project in Macedonia, will significantly increase social
            cohesion, through the social integration of youth at risk
            from different socio-cultural backgrounds. To this end,
            community-based approaches will be tested to support
            adolescents, and youth at risk, and, institutional capacity
            will be strengthened, to contribute to the implementation of
            a Children and Youth Strategy. The two main components will:
            1) continue to test methods, and experimentation, through
            existing Babylon youth centers. The inter-ethnic youth
            activities cover sports, computer, and information
            technology (IT) training. And, in addition to regular
            scholastic activities, English language, social skills and
            creativity, journalism, and seminars and workshops will be
            supported. Innovative approaches will be explored for youth
            social integration, through the use of outreach, and
            targeted pilot programs, by establishing eight new centers,
            proposed by nongovernmental organizations in a demand-driven
            selection process, designed to elicit new ideas in
            disadvantaged areas. Expansion of the Youth and Sport's
            innovative drug abuse prevention program will be supported
            for all secondary schools in the country, and to the Babylon
            centers; and, 2) consolidate the youth component, by
            supporting the participatory development of the Children,
            and Youth Strategy, to promote ownership, and sustainability
            of the program, and, by establishing monitoring mechanisms
            to facilitate institutional capacity building.
